comment: The Pythagorean theorem for an arbitrary complex inner product (pre-Hilbert) space ` U ` . The square of the norm of the sum of two orthogonal vectors (i.e. whose inner product is 0) is the sum of the squares of their norms. Problem 2 in [Kreyszig] p. 135. This is Metamath 100 proof #4. (Contributed by NM, 17-Apr-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
